isis.stitle: TSI 94-12-05 - Method to Clean Oil From A Chassis Mounted Charge Air Coolant

subjectgroup.subject: Method to Clean Oil From A Chassis Mounted Charge Air Coolant

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to all models with a charge air cooler.

If a turbocharger failure occurs which allows oil to enter the chassis mounted charge air cooler, the contaminated cooler must be removed from the vehicle and cleaned. The following procedure should be used to clean a charge air cooler after it has been removed from the vehicle.

step1.para: Remove charge air cooler from vehicle.
Drain as much oil as possible by gravity through either or both openings.
Use a detergent soap such as a no suds dishwasher soap mixed with hot water. Fill, agitate and flush the charge air cooler until all oil is removed.

note.para: This step may need to be repeated more than once to completely remove all oil from the cooler.

step1.para: Rinse with hot water until all soap solution is removed and the water used to rinse is clear after it has circulated completely through the cooler.
Circulate compressed air through the cooler to remove most of the remaining rinse water.

warning.para: Over pressure from compressed air can cause damage to the charge air cooler and/or injury to people near by.
Be sure to wear eye protection while blowing water out of the charge air cooler with compressed air. Failure to wear eye protection may cause serious damage or loss of the use of one or both eyes.

step1.para: Re-install charge air cooler in vehicle leaving the outlet disconnected from the intake piping (cold side).

Start the engine and run at low RPM observing the charge air cooler outlet. Precautions should be taken to prevent foreign material from being drawn into the engine through the cold side intake pipe while performing this step. When outlet air becomes completely free of water residue, stop engine and re-install the engine intake side piping to the charge air cooler.
Check leakage integrity of the complete intake system described in Step 2, Air Induction Pressure Test in CTS-5087, CHARGE AIR SYSTEM in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Road test and check intake manifold pressure as described on engine diagnostic form CGED-115, step 10 "Intake Manifold Pressure".
